problem.markdown:
1. If a negative of an given image is created by subtracting all the pixel values from the maximum grey value, then the shape of the histogram of the new image will be
( ) Different from the original ( ) Same as original (x) Negated as well ( ) Shifted towards high gray levels
2. After rotating the input image by 180, histogram of the new image will be
( ) Rotated by 180 (x) Same as original ( ) Shifted toward high gray levels ( ) Shifted toward low gray levels
3. If the histogram of any image is uniformly distributed on all gray levels, image will be of
( ) Good quality ( ) Bad quality ( ) Low contrast (x) Cannot say
4. If a constant value is added to every pixel in an image then its histogram will
(x) Shift to the right ( ) Shift to the left ( ) Remain unchanged ( ) None of the above
5. Maximum number of bins in the histogram of an image with bit depth 10 is
(x) 1024 ( ) 128 ( ) 1000 ( ) 256
